patterns.pattern: For class-related events, always formats as '[COURSE CODE] Type' where type is Lecture, Section, Lab, or Office Hours
Course codes for Math department include space before number (MATH 0180), other departments don't (CS101, ENGN0520)
For assignments and homework, format is 'COURSE CODE Assignment/HW# Due'
Personal events use title case with no special formatting
For class events, description includes topics to be covered, formatted as bullet points with dashes
examples:
- Binary search trees
- Graph algorithms
- Dynamic programming

patterns.pattern: For assignments, description includes what needs to be submitted and any special requirements
examples:
Submit: PDF writeup + code
Requirements: Must include unit tests

Turn in via Gradescope
Partner work allowed

patterns.pattern: Zoom links are always placed at the end of the description on their own line
When office hours are mentioned, description includes what topics can be discussed or what help is available
examples: Can ask about Assignment 2, midterm prep

patterns.pattern: Academic events (lectures, sections, exams) use color ID '2' (turquoise)
Assignment deadlines use color ID '11' (red) for high visibility
Personal events use color ID '9' (blue)
Club meetings and extracurriculars use color ID '5' (yellow)
For on-campus locations, format is 'Building Name - Room Number'
For virtual meetings, just writes 'Zoom' in location field and puts link in description
Office hours locations include professor's office number
Lectures are 50 minutes (university standard)
Lab sessions are 3 hours (180 minutes)
Office hours are typically 1 hour unless specified otherwise
Club meetings are usually 1.5 hours (90 minutes)
Classes typically scheduled at standard Brown time slots: 9am, 10am, 1pm, 2pm, 3pm
Assignment deadlines are almost always at 9:00 PM or 11:59 PM
Office hours tend to be right after class or in early afternoon

usage_patterns.pattern: Primary calendar used for ALL academic events (classes, assignments, exams)
Also used for important personal appointments (doctor, dentist) and social events
This calendar has recurring weekly events for all classes
Used ONLY for robotics club meetings and events
Never used for personal events or other clubs
Read-only calendar subscribed to for holiday awareness, not actively used for event creation

patterns.pattern: When event title contains 'Midterm' or 'Final', always sets duration to 90 minutes and adds 'Closed book, no notes' to description if not specified
When event mentions 'group project' or 'team meeting', always adds location (either physical or Zoom)
When creating recurring weekly class events, always uses the same colorId (2) and duration (50 min)
If event is on weekend (Saturday/Sunday), it's almost always personal/social and uses blue color (9)

general_observations: User has very structured calendar with clear separation between academic and personal events
Strong preference for consistency in formatting (course codes, colors, durations)
Always includes detailed information in descriptions for academic events
Tends to schedule personal events during gaps between classes
Uses recurring events extensively for regular commitments (classes, club meetings)
Assignment deadlines are always marked with red color for visibility
Never uses emojis in event titles
